storyName: A Bolt From the Blue Oasis
storyInfo: In a nameless Ursus village, a mysterious doctor performs emergency surgery on an acute Oripathy sufferer. It is then her past finds her—the relative of a Sarcophagus incident victim, Lillia, wants Kal'tsit to assist with her revenge.

attributes.content: 17 Years Ago
3:09 P.M. \ Clear
Ursus, 147km northwest from the main course of nomadic city Chernobog, village
A hamlet...
Quick, quick, the doctor says to get warm water!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Where would we find warm water so easily? Ask Marfa, ask if her family still has any water they boiled this morning.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Emperor above, we beg you, bless our old dedushka...
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Excuse me... What's happening here; who's the doctor you mentioned?
Oh, you're... who are you?
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Where did you come from... your clothes mean you're from the city, right? Sorry, sorry, we're busy aiding someone right now... If you don't mind, come with me this way, at least you'll have a place to sit.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: It's okay... I came here to find that doctor, as it happens. What's her name?
You... you're not here to...
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: She's just a shady doctor. Do you have great trust in her?
But she... she's all we have who can save our dedushka. I beg you, I'm begging you, at least just for now—she's only a doctor here to save us.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: I'm not here to seize her. I just have a little business with her.
Could you show me the way?
I... I don't know if...
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: I'm a doctor too. Perhaps I can be of help.
Oh, even a burdenbeast would know you're a scholar, seeing your clothes...
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: You can tell Dr. Kal'tsit something first. Tell her, her student Lillia's here to visit her, and ask her if she needs any assistance or not.
Ah, so you know the doctor's name, and you're Lillia, is that right? Good, good, truly a wonderful name. Wait there for a moment, I'll go right now.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Ay, hey! Don't forget to ask Marfa, bring warm water over!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Ugh, ughah...
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: Grit your teeth, and keep holding on.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ugheaaagh—grh—
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: ...Kal'tsit...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: What's going on here?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Attacked by a wild beast. This is just emergency treatment.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Knife.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ah, er... where—where was it... I can't find...
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Here. Hand.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: An Infected creature?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Any risk of Infection?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Most Infected creatures are cleaner than people imagine. By the toothmarks, a tuskbeast roaming the vicinity.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But if it's come into contact with active Originium...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Infected creatures may have methods to coexist with pathogens, but humans do not.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The situation is severe. This is not Originium infection alone. Additional necrosis symptoms are present.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hurts... so much...
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: Calm down, now. Deep breaths.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hphhh—haaah—hphhh—
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: Difficulty breathing, likely thrombosis. All symptomatic of acute Oripathy.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: But—But doesn't Oripathy make crystals grow out of your skin?! Our dedushka's fine, see, isn't he?!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: In certain circumstances, the source of infection ends up rapidly circulating through the blood, and won't present visible Originium crystals like regular cases of Oripathy do. Infection symptoms intensify within a short time, very quickly.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: If we don't suppress it via drugs... mm.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Emperor above, Emperor above...
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: You've learned a lot.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Syringes are... inside the gray medical kit.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Here... You carried a suppressant like this with you?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: There's always times of need.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Wait... *cough* *cough* Do—Doctor... is this—expensive?
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: Thinking about that at a time like this?!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: It's affordable. You have no need to worry. Our top priority right now is suppressing your acute Oripathic responses, and prevent an Originium crystal dust outburst.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You don't want the others in the village to suffer because of you, correct?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ugh!
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: Steady breaths. Relax.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You'll be fine.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ngh, alright...
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: Hfff—haaah—
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: Urgh... hff... do—doctor... I don't want to... become Inf... *cough* *cough*... Infected...
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: I'm very sorry.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I... *sob*... I... *cough* *cough*... *cough* *hack* *cough*...
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: Suffocation. We don't have a respirator...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: We have nothing here, but that doesn't mean we can do nothing. Bring the inhaler over.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Doctor! Doctor! I'm begging you, save this dedushka of ours, damn it!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: The moment Originium dust permeated his wounds, it was inevitable he'd become an Infected, and all I can do is strive to extend his life.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hck, *cough*, *hack* *cough* *cough*—huff, hahh—
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: Has the suppressant still not taken effect?!
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Considering the patient's age, the suppressant itself was a tremendous risk. Hold your nerve.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...hah... hah...
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: Breathing has stabilized some...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Is he better now? Is his sickness gone?
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: In terms of his acute symptoms, possibly. But if you mean his Oripathy, we can do nothing. No one can do anything.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: How could this... Then if the man from the Patrol Unit comes by...
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Then just—Then just give me... give me up! I only had so long left anyway... Infected? Fine, so be it... Just as long as you don't let the eggheads in here to run their mouths...
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: No! We wouldn't, we wouldn't, we just have to hide you. We won't let anyone find you. We'll all hide you safely.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Doctor, thank you so much, doctor, things might not have turned out best, but we... well, we don't have much to repay you with either...
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: This is merely a doctor's duty. The path ahead of becoming an Infected... is what you truly need to consider. I'm very sorry, that circumstances couldn't permit me to do more.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Suppressant is effective, but wounds are still infected. It may lead to worsening of thrombosis... We may have to operate and excise...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Your judgment is correct. Good sir. Please bear with this.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Agh—alright... alright... eaaargh, ungh—!
attributes.name: Patient

attributes.content: Sorry about that, Lillia.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Long time no see, Director Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Long time no see. Let's walk and talk.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Perhaps... you're not enthused about conversing with me like this after that bloodbath, but from the bottom of my heart, I'm glad you're still alive.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So after that, you hid here the whole time?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: From the hill over there, you can see out to Chernobog's skyscrapers. If it were me, I wouldn't opt to shelter so near a cityway.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: I'm only stopping over for the moment, nothing more.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: What... What have you been doing, ever since?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: I don't wish for the hate between you to continue flowing unabated. In particular, it's a hatred that will not only cause one to find their own ruin, but will strongly attract direct reprisal from those murderers.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You're telling me all this on purpose, aren't you?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: I won't deny that, Lillia. But...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit, you're leaving?
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Ah, it's...
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: My student. No alarm, she came to pick me up.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ah, I see, then... But, well, pick you up?
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Oh, Emperor above... You're going after all then?
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: If you're going, please tell us! You cured my daughter, so at least let us send you off properly!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: I will.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ah, alright, alright, then we'll leave you two alone. You have to tell us before you go, please, Dr. Kal'tsit... don't forget.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: The people here seem to like you.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: They've shown enough goodwill already. I've merely done my work as a doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: They're the ones who live true Ursus lives. We've spent so long in the Research Institute, there's plenty we've forgotten.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Even positioning themselves near a cityway couldn't bring them opportunity, nor prosperity.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Precisely the opposite. A tyrant official with subordinate power took hold there, exploiting the poor folk to offer the Patrol Unit yet more convenient soil.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So they can't even find one run-of-the-mill doctor graduated from medical school. And one run-of-the-mill flu strain could kill a tender young girl.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Your horizons are vast. Yes, they've always been... You'd still treat a flu for someone? I thought...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: You thought I was a scientist who gesticulated at papers and data.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: To be honest, you're more a doctor than I even imagined.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Perhaps I always was a doctor. What changes is only the treatment subject and the locus to contend with.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It's why your students put so much faith in you.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Lillia.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: How's your daughter?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I left her with a friend of mine. She has no connection to all this whatsoever.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: You know... how young she is. She doesn't even speak yet. She hasn't begun to walk...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: And I left behind my child just like that.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: You could've chosen not to do this. If you wanted Louisa to live on, identity concealed—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You should know what I think, Director Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: I just want to try and stop you. But if not even your daughter can stall your step, perhaps my words won't reach you either.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That's right. I'm quite clear about that.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Winter's so cold this year.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Vampilov's father went mad from his son's death. He kept fowlbeasts penned in a loft by the lake, and every day would fantasize for a while he was going hunting with his son.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Ilia's child, Lyudmila, she's still young, but already comprehends certain, irreversible things. Nobody even knows how she's doing nowadays.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: And Romanovich, too. His family sold off their whole estate, and left that city. Even if his brothers never believed in any accident, there were people to shut them up.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: And for even more. The police announced it was an accident down to the finest thing.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: In that 'list of accidental casualties,' not a single person had left Chernobog's research institute. An experimental accident leading to a chain reaction, and reported identities of bodies provided by the military.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: But a kind of intuition tells me... some are alive.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Intuition?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Because afterwards, all relatives of the victims, more or less, received anonymous aid—as well as a warning.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: I don't think that spineless, incompetent Count Boris, nor Sergei, that traitor, would have any mercy in them. So, someone else who knows what happened has to have survived.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: But it took until today, three years later, before I found you, Director Kal'tsit. It took until today. You hid so well, you even fooled the Secret Police's eyes...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: They rely too much on Ursus's latest technology for criminal investigation. It actually created an opening for me.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Of course... you're a hailed genius. An incomparable research leader. That's why everyone embraces you so.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: —Please tell me, Lillia. How many people signed on to your plan?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Six or seven. Maybe even more; we don't dare meet together in public. We might be caught, used for leverage.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: That includes me. All lost things in that 'accident' they can never have back.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: When did you start plotting all of this?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: From the moment I found out the Fourth Army's lackeys fired the first bolt in the Research Institute, mercilessly shredding the father of my children's throat. From that moment, I started.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Lillia...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Don't take me as a brave fool. Even if my health gives me so little time to work with you all... I've still accomplished one thing or another. Such as—
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: You found the whereabouts of Grand Duke Vanya. The Pine Valley Retreat, situated beyond any nomadic city.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: And this former Fourth Army staff officer was also highly likely to be a Grand Duke of Ursus actualizing the Sarcophagus incident, perhaps right in the frailest, weakest position of his endlessly long campaign career.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You want to conduct an assassination, Lillia, but this act of vengeance can still be considered 'bravely foolish.'
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Heh.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: I can finally see why my husband... why that Astrov looked up to you so.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: But you must know, Lillia, assassinating an old Grand Duke will have no significance at all.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Maybe from the start, Vanya, the man so decrepit he needs cardiac stimulant injections when he gives speeches, was not the real murderer.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I know, Kal'tsit, I know...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: But do you really think when I entrusted Louisa to someone else, it was just for a rational ending, a so-called fair trial? As if you can't guess, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Blind revenge will only cause you to lack foresight.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit, Kal'tsit. Perhaps you couldn't understand.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Louisa never even learned to say 'papa.'
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: You can sit.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: How long have you spent in here?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Not worth mentioning. Lillia. You look awful. You need to rest.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: How did you find me?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Just sheer chance... if not for sheer chance, perhaps I'd have never learned you were still alive.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Lyudmila.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: We didn't want our children coming to too much harm, so at first, we planned to look for Lyudmila.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: But then, we learned from Lyudmila's housekeeper that someone was sustaining contact with them, aiding them. Someone anonymous, but she seemed to know it all, inside and out.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: The same anonym had even set up a way for her to leave Ursus.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: It was then I was sure that some were still alive. And to my knowledge, very few could accomplish something like that.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Have some tea.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Here I imagined you'd be itching to ask about my business at the Retreat.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Lillia, I imagine the one who's really itching here is you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And you knew all along exactly where Vanya was... you're really just going to sit on the sidelines? You should know all the secrets he's holding onto!
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: The true secrets have already been sealed for eternity in that research institute, thanks to Ilia's perseverance. Even now, the Army haven't been able to find a single scrap of the gains they were drooling for.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And Grand Duke Vanya is incurably ill. He'll recuperate at Pine Valley every winter. Provided you have any way to sneak into a so-called high-class salon even once, it's not hard to come by the information.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: He even brags all over about how the retreat is so beautiful and vast.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Correct. There is no shortage of Ursus soldiers with outstanding service there, and of course, bureaucrats and nobles too.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Infiltrating it and assassinating a Grand Duke would be as absurd as you, in Chernobog, charging into Count Boris's house with a knife, slitting his throat open and then escaping again untouched.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You're right. But for those 'bureaucrats and nobles,' security in there is still weak enough to make people restless.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: I won't deny that. But how do you know that's not a signal, one that Grand Duke Vanya is no longer an important figure, or that...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Or that his fate has already been set by certain people? I've told you, Kal'tsit, what I want isn't a fair trial. To make it clear, what I long for is a lynching.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Now's not the time to discuss justice or morality, Kal'tsit. Only those who can rest easy at night enjoy using 'objectivity' as a shield.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Whether Grand Duke Vanya is censured by the military or the Emperor, becomes a scapegoat, stands the wrong side in political conflict, suffers banishment, is stowed away by the Army...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: —No matter what, even if he dies miserably in the end at the gallows, what business is that of mine?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: It was him who pushed for all of Chernobog to sink into deeper ruin, and all I know is he should pay the price. He should pay the price to us! He's the murderer who killed my child's father!
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Kal'tsit!
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: I'm listening...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I've already figured out how to infiltrate the retreat... but I also need to admit, even if the security there is suspiciously weak, that doesn't mean any of us can pull this off smoothly.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: I've found a breach. Someone who's been in charge of security at that noble's sanatorium for thirty-plus years, but hasn't had the guts to make much side-money off it for fear of the nobles.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: I... prepared a huge sum, with my colleagues' help. That complete life failure, who we all saw could retire any day, caved in instantly.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: We spent immense effort to gain his trust. I was simply the daughter of a country upstart, only wanting to intern at the retreat to get close with some noble or officer.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: You want me to help you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yes. Forging any identity has risks no matter what, but to my mind, the retreat and the information agency wouldn't be that tied up, so—
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: If even the Secret Police are fooled into thinking you're dead—
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: —then death will be your open road.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.text: In 1080, the Sarcophagus Incident's surviving scientist, Sergei, established a brand-new research institute.
The same year, Count Boris vastly expanded Chernobog's industrial region. The Fourth Army's Messengers, for the first time in history, found the Count's door was closed to them there.
Lyudmila was still young, and Louisa was but one amongst countless children, so Kal'tsit thought. She could comprehend that Lillia, as a mother, had complex, cruel expectations of these children.
And after the Chernobog Core City's engine underwent its umpteenth major maintenance, it still turned with a rumble.
